metadata.title: Shaag & Maach Bhaja। শাক ও মাছ ভাজা । Bengali Recipe
metadata.description:
Shaag & Maach Bhaja by Masuda Bibi of Gorbhanga I রুরাল রেসিপির সপ্তম পর্ব । নদীয়ার গোরভাঙার বাসিন্দা মাসুদা বিবির হাতের রান্না :  শাক ও মাছ ভাজা।

In typical middle-class households across Bengal, it was customary to start meals with a leafy vegetable dish, varying based on the region and season. These vegetables were often sourced from local fields, harvesting areas, or the edges of ponds, rather than purchased from markets, and were known by different names in different areas.  Women of the household would skillfully craft delicious dishes from these nutritious greens, a practice that has sadly dwindled with time.

Additionally, men would often engage in fishing at village ponds, bringing home a variety of small and large fish.  The women would then transform these catches into mouth-watering delicacies, showcasing their culinary prowess and creating cherished family meals.


Rural local recipes are integral part of Intangible Cultural Heritage and needs to be preserved and promoted.  We at banglanatak dot com have been working for the past 22+ years to safeguard and promote local cultural heritages in rural spaces across India. We are now launching a new initiative of documenting rural recipes and bringing them closer to the food lovers of the world.  We request all to subscribe to our new channel Rural Recipes and stay tuned there to know, learn and try out local delicacies.
